original_title: Sri Lanka tea production up in May 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s tea production grew 1.9 percent to 26.5 million kilograms in May 2023 from a year ago, industry data showed, with all elevations seeing increased output in the second quarter of the year.

Orthodox high grown teas were up 9.5 percent to 7 million kilos, medium growns were up 0.4 percent to 4.8 million kilos and low growns were down 0.9 percent to 14.7 million kilos, data from Ceylon Tea Brokers showed.
CTC tea production grew to 2.5 million kilos in March 2023 from 2.4 million last year.
Green tea production picked up to 248,211 kilos from 148.9 million last year.
In the first quarter production was down 7.2 percent to 58.52 million kilos.

Sri Lanka’s tea production has been in decline for several years due to the combined effect of banning the weedicide glyphosate and later chemical fertilizer, which weakened plantations with a lagged effects, according to industry officials.
Production is expected to recover in 2023, with the fertilizer being applied.

In 2021, Sri Lanka produced 251 million kilograms of tea and the new target of 2023 is around 272-280 million kilograms, with an expected forex revenue of 1.5 billion US dollars. (Colombo/June22/2023)
